Short-term Insurance.title: P&C Market Update: U.S. Insurance Industry Shows Greater Stability and Moderating Rate Increases
Short-term Insurance.snippet: Alera Group's 2025 Property and Casualty Market Update highlights continued stabilization in the U.S. insurance market and signs of softening following several years of significant rate increases.  Key findings include greater stability in insurer pricing, moderating rate increases, and adequate capacity across most lines of business.

Motor Insurance.title: Car insurance: The powerhouse of US property & casualty
Motor Insurance.snippet: In 2024, car insurance claimed 41.6% of the P&C market - solidly ahead of property coverage (35.7%) and liability insurance (19.5%). In raw premiums, private-passenger auto insurance brought in an impressive $344 billion by March 3, 2025—nearly 35% of all written premiums.

Home Insurance.title: P&C Market Update: U.S. Insurance Industry Shows Greater Stability and Moderating Rate Increases
Home Insurance.snippet: Alera Group's 2025 Property and Casualty Market Update highlights continued stabilization in the U.S. insurance market and signs of softening following several years of significant rate increases.  Key findings include greater stability, moderating increases, adequate capacity, and continued challenges in certain lines of insurance.

Personal Accident Insurance.title: P&C Insurance Market Returns to Underwriting Profitability After Premium Hikes
Personal Accident Insurance.snippet: The property casualty insurance industry continued to stabilize in 2024, with a swing from close to a $22 billion net underwriting loss to a nearly $25 billion net underwriting gain. However, despite a return to profitability, headwinds continue to impact the p&c insurance market, particularly the personal lines segment.

Liability Insurance.title: Could a Florida bar brawl case reshape insurer bad faith liability?
Liability Insurance.snippet: A Florida bar brawl liability dispute could have potential ripple effects nationwide when catastrophic losses exceed policy limits.

Liability Insurance.title: Global property and casualty insurance market has increased efficiency, capacity and resilience, finds Swiss Re Institute
Liability Insurance.snippet: The Swiss Re Institute's sigma report finds that the global P&C insurance market has doubled in size over the past 20 years, reaching USD 2.4 trillion.  The report highlights increased efficiency, capacity, and resilience, along with the growing use of alternative risk solutions and the increasing role of smaller, specialized players.

Liability Insurance.title: P&C Market Update: U.S. Insurance Industry Shows Greater Stability and Moderating Rate Increases
Liability Insurance.snippet: Alera Group's 2025 Property and Casualty Market Update highlights continued stabilization in the U.S. insurance market and signs of softening after years of significant rate increases.  Key findings include greater stability, moderating increases in premiums, adequate capacity in most lines of business, and continued challenges in areas like Commercial Auto Liability.

Pet Insurance.title: Market Forecast News: Pet Insurance Industry to Hit $29.80B by 2030
Pet Insurance.snippet: The pet insurance market is experiencing strong growth, fueled by demographic, economic, and technological factors.  The report projects the market to reach USD 29.80 billion by 2030 from USD 14.35 billion in 2025, growing at a CAGR of 15.7%.

Pet Insurance.title: Unleashing Untapped P&C Potential: How the Booming Pet Insurance Market Fuels Growth
Pet Insurance.snippet: The pet insurance market is experiencing significant and sustained growth, with double-digit growth rates year after year.  This presents a compelling strategic opportunity for P&C insurers to tap into a new revenue stream and gain a competitive edge.

Pet Insurance.title: Best Pet Insurance Companies for September 2025 - NerdWallet
Pet Insurance.snippet: NerdWallet evaluated pet insurers across the country to find the ones with the best combination of coverage, financial strength, consumer experience and plan options.  MetLife is rated as the best overall due to its comprehensive coverage, including holistic care and grief counseling.

AIG.title: Fitch sees further P&C underwriting gains in H2, flags wildfire, tariff risks
AIG.snippet: Fitch Ratings expects property and casualty insurers to continue to post underwriting profitability in the second half of the year.  American International Group (AIG) is mentioned among other P&C insurance stocks.  Wildfire damage and tariff-driven inflation are cited as potential risks.

AIG.title: 2025 US P&C Insurance Market Report projects stability amid broader volatility
AIG.snippet: A rapid turnaround in the private auto business led the US property and casualty industry back to underwriting profitability in 2024 and will help keep it there for the next several years, the newly released S&P Global Market Intelligence 2025 US Property and Casualty (P&C) Insurance Market Report projects.

AIG.title: US P&C insurance industry to remain profitable for several years: S&P
AIG.snippet: The US property and casualty (P&C) insurance sector is projected to remain profitable for the next several years, driven mainly by a rapid turnaround in the private auto sector in 2024, according to a recent S&P report.

Allianz.title: Allianz Announces Excellent Performance and Is Fully on Track for Full-year Ambitions
Allianz.snippet: In 2Q 2025, Allianz's Property-Casualty insurance total business volume reached €20.1 billion.  Operating profit grew 20 percent to €2.3 billion, with the combined ratio improving to 91.2 percent.

Old Mutual.title: Short-term Insurance The Case for Consolidation - Old Mutual
Old Mutual.snippet: Given ongoing consumer strain, a lack of compelling economic growth, the high cost of regulatory compliance and a complex risk environment, short-term insurers are facing strong headwinds, ones in which only the strongest can survive.

Old Mutual.title: How Blue Sky is powering Old Mutual Insure's growth - FAnews
Old Mutual.snippet: With the short-term insurance industry rapidly evolving, Old Mutual Insure is using strategic acquisitions to stay ahead of the curve. Its Blue-Sky division has become a key driver of growth and diversification within the group.

Old Mutual.title: Short-term Insurance The Case for Consolidation - Old Mutual
Old Mutual.snippet: Given ongoing consumer strain, a lack of compelling economic growth, the high cost of regulatory compliance and a complex risk environment, short-term insurers are facing strong headwinds, ones in which only the strongest can survive. Increasingly, the biggest players are dominating the sector and looking to acquire smaller insurers to diversify.

Santam.title: Santam 2025 insurance barometer highlights ongoing socioeconomic, infrastructure and climate change risks
Santam.snippet: Santam's 2025 Insurance Barometer Report reveals that despite economic hardship, only 1% of consumers cancelled short-term insurance policies.  Crime remains a concern, but Santam's stricter underwriting and risk management have helped stabilize crime-related claims.  Intermediaries remain crucial, shifting from sales agents to risk management partners.

Discovery Insure.title: Discovery Insure expands short-term P&C offerings
Discovery Insure.snippet: Discovery Insure announced today the expansion of its short-term property and casualty insurance products, including new coverage options for renters and homeowners.

Insurance Regulatory Authority.title: Pennsylvania Regulator Has Nixed $200M in P/C Insurance Rate Hikes in First 6 Months
Insurance Regulatory Authority.snippet: The Pennsylvania Insurance Department (PID) reported that its actuaries denied $210.1 million in requested property/casualty (P/C) insurance premium increases in the first six months of 2025.

Financial Conduct Authority (FCA).title: FCA updates on insurance market
Financial Conduct Authority (FCA).snippet: The FCA released updates for the insurance sector, including a market study on premium finance, analysis of rising motor insurance claim costs, a review of claims handling in home and travel insurance, and a review of General Insurance Pricing Practices (GIPP) remedies.

National Treasury.title: National Treasury's Short-Term P&C Insurance Strategy Amidst Economic Uncertainty
National Treasury.snippet: The National Treasury is reportedly adjusting its short-term property and casualty insurance portfolio in response to rising interest rates and market volatility.  Experts predict a shift towards more conservative investments.

National Treasury.title: Could return of short-term health insurance provide relief to some employers?
National Treasury.snippet: The U.S. Labor Department, with the U.S. Treasury Department and the U.S Department of Health and Human Services, released a statement earlier this month that blesses the use of “short-term, limited-duration insurance” policies that last more than three months.  The new non-enforcement policy appears to mean that insurers and others can return to letting these health insurance policies stay in effect for up to 36 months.

Reserve Bank.title: Ratings agencies cautious on reinsurance pricing and reserves
Reserve Bank.snippet: In the run-up to the Monte Carlo Rendez-Vous, a consensus of sorts emerged among the major rating agencies: the reinsurance sector is transitioning from a period of exceptional profitability to one marked by increasing challenges and shifting dynamics.

Insurance Ombudsman.title: Insurance ombudsmen, short-staffed, struggle with rising case loads
Insurance Ombudsman.snippet: The insurance ombudsman system is facing challenges due to vacancies, with three ombudsman positions vacant and seven more expected to retire by October 2024.  During the 2023-24 fiscal year, the 17 insurance ombudsman centres together received 52,575 complaints and disposed of 49,705 cases.  A significant portion of complaints are related to health insurance.
